text: Without speaking to the web API side of the question, for the ML stuff, Flux should be fine for your use-case (assuming your models will be standard ones for image classification or sentiment analysis).

elements.text: Without speaking to the web API side of the question, for the ML stuff, Flux should be fine for your use-case (assuming your models will be standard ones for image classification or sentiment analysis).

text: Though the problem sounds like something that other languages/frameworks do well too, so maybe worth thinking about what advantage you would like to demonstrate here.

elements.text: Though the problem sounds like something that other languages/frameworks do well too, so maybe worth thinking about what advantage you would like to demonstrate here.

text:
You can probably do that with:
• HTTP.jl
• JSON3.jl
• Some ML (say Flux.jl or Metalhead.jl)
• and some db client (say LibPQ.jl)
For a basic API, I would avoid doing the front-end, GUI like… just focus on a simple API where you pass text and get back the sentiment scores or whatnot.
See the example here:
• <@UC4QQPG4A> gave a workshop: “How to Build a Model Using Flux and Productionize It?” which did exactly what you described… can’t find a copy of it but maybe <@U67461GUB> are old JuliaComputing workshops be made accessible somewhere? The Zoom recordings maybe?
• <https://youtu.be/uLhXgt_gKJc>

attachments.title: JuliaCon 2020 |  Building Microservices and Applications in Julia
